Comment: Wanting to slow the game down.
The young lady has been brushing up on her game and is confident enough to try a non-Classical line.
Natrural.
Heading for...
..after this move...
...a Nimzo-Indian.
Aggresive play. 4 Q-B2 also guards the N but doesn't put the B en prise.
Guarding.
Opening the line for the KB to guard the QBP.
Challenging the center.
6 N-B3 was the right move. Now White falls behind in development.
The girl smartly opens up the board with this temporary sacrifice.
Her boyfriend takes up the challenge.
Adding pressure to the pinned Knight.
White goes in for the counterpin.
Winning back the material and provoking White into a fatal trap.
White *thinks* he has just won a piece. Obviously NxQ is impossible, as the Knight is pinned to the King... right?
Brilliant! The pin vanishes like smoke in a sirocco wind!
Forced...
...but now the Queen falls. White had the dignity to resign and congratulate his girlfriend on her brilliant play.
